The stairs are fixed in space and do not need to connect with another structure to maintain their integrity. They can support any amount of weight while they exist.
When the spell ends or is dismissed, the stairs disappear and anything on them falls.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a slot of 5th level or higher, then you increase the maximum height by 10 feet per level higher than 4th

spell.name: Shadow Tool
entries: You pull together shadow substance to craft a nonmagical tool, weapon, or piece of ammunition of your choice, which appears held in your hand(s). The crafted object functions as normal (but is not flammable, poisonous, or edible) unless heavily damaged or broken to pieces, at which point the spell ends and the object vanishes. The object you choose to craft can not be heavier than 100 lb. and must be entirely composed of solid materials.

spell.name: Silent Speak
entries: When a willing creature that you touch attempts to speak, instead of sound coming from the creature, its words appear as floating illusory text characters made of light, no larger than a few inches each, that are only visible to those that the creature wishes to communicate with.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a slot of 2nd level or higher, you can add another target for the spell per level higher than 1st. In addition, when you cast this spell with a slot of 4th level or higher, the text characters appear to the viewer in a language that they understand, even if there are multiple viewers that understand different languages.

spell.name: Sky Paint
entries: You create a still, intangible 2-dimensional image that appears in a part of the sky you can see. The image can be anything you can imagine, and can be as wide as 100 feet. Creatures that closely approach the image can easily recognize it as an illusion. You can take an action to change the image to any other image you can imagine.

spell.name: Stirring Image
entries: You invoke the memories of one creature you can see within range, causing them to experience an emotionally moving vision of their past, perhaps a moment of triumph or tragedy; the vision raises the target's morale, granting the target advantage on death saving throws, Strength ability checks, Strength saving throws, Charisma ability checks, and Charisma saving throws until the end of its next turn.

spell.name: Storm of Clones
entries: Eight illusory duplicates of yourself appear, each one in an unoccupied space you can see within range. On each of your turns, you can use a bonus action to mentally command the duplicates you made with this spell. You can mentally command only a single duplicate for a specific action, but a general command can be given to all duplicates (within 30 feet) simultaneously.

Each duplicate acts on your initiative, taking actions and moving where you will it to. A general command such as guarding a creature, object, or location can be given, which the duplicate will continue following until you give it a different command. If no commands are given, the duplicate will only defend itself against hostile creatures. When commanded, each duplicate can make a melee weapon attack or ranged weapon attack against a creature (if the target is within range), using a nonmagical duplicate of a weapon (and ammunition) that you are currently wielding; the attack roll uses your spell attack modifier.

Each duplicate's AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier, and it is destroyed on a hit. The duplicates ignore all other damage and effects. All equipment duplicated by this spell is nonmagical and vanishes if the distance between it and the duplicate from which it originated exceeds 30 feet.
When the spell ends, the duplicates vanish, as well as any equipment that was duplicated with them

spell.name: Storyteller's Emergence
entries: You point your finger at written text in a single book, scroll, or on a patch of surface no larger than 100 feet in any direction is made to appear as if written in a language known by the reader (other types of writing medium may be targeted, at the DM's discretion). An intangible illusory duplicate(s) of the target text's author(s) appears within an unoccupied space of your choice within 30 feet of the text and begins to speak the written text aloud from beginning to end (up to the maximum safe volume for listeners). The duplicate's appearance is randomly chosen from however the author appeared while writing or dictating the text.

The duplicate speaks the written text in completion even if parts of it are damaged or missing. You can take an action to stop the spoken text, move it back to an earlier part, or move it forward as much as you desire. When the spell ends, the duplicate vanishes.

spell.name: Sudden Displacement

time.condition: when you are hit by an attack

entries: As a creature you can see is about to hit you with an attack, you cause the image of your actual location to be displaced, forcing the attack roll to be rerolled with disadvantage.

spell.name: Temporary Restoration

m.text: a drop of adhesive liquid, which the spell consumes

entries: You gather shadow substance to fill in the cracks and replace the missing pieces of a damaged nonmagical object or structure (or part of it) no larger than a 20-foot cube. The object or structure functions as if whole and undamaged for the duration. You can take an action to dismiss the spell.
If this spell is cast as a ritual, the duration is extended to a maximum of 8 hours.

spell.name: Tethered Image
entries: An intangible illusion of a creature, object, or structure of your imagining is projected at a location you can see within range; the illusion can be no larger than a 20-foot length cube and can be set to be {@condition invisible} or suppressed until certain conditions of your choice are triggered. You can set the illusion to move up to a speed of 60 feet (including flight) in a pattern of your choice (including random patterns and changes of speed) within 120 feet of the target location, which can also be set to be triggered by circumstances of your choice. If this spell is cast as a ritual, you can replace the material component with powdered gemstones worth at least 100 gp to make the spell permanent until dispelled.

spell.name: Tiny Clone
entries: You create a Tiny illusory duplicate of yourself that moves at half your speed and can interact physically with objects; it appears within an unoccupied space within range. The duplicate can move or pick up objects weighting up to 5 lb. and follows your mental commands.

The duplicate has an AC of 10 + your Dexterity modifier, and is destroyed on a single hit. It ignores all other damage and effects. If the duplicate moves more than 30 feet away from you, the spell ends and the duplicate vanishes.

On each of your turns, you can use a bonus action to mentally command the duplicate you made with this spell. The duplicate acts on your initiative, taking actions and moving where you will it to. A general command such as guarding a creature, object, or location can be given, which the duplicate will continue following until you give it a different command. If no commands are given, the duplicate will only defend itself against hostile creatures.
The duplicate can make a slam attack using your spell attack modifier for 0 points of bludgeoning damage (1 point on a critical hit).

spell.name: Titanic Image
entries: You project the image of a creature, object, or structure of your imagining in an unoccupied space within range, and it can be made as large as what can fit in a 1000 foot-long cube (with a minimum length of 50 feet). Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, because it is intangible (otherwise it looks and sounds like it is real).

If the illusion is a creature's image, you can take an action to mentally command it to act and move as you desire, with a speed of 60 feet, or fly speed of 120 feet (it maintains the same fly speed in a liquid environment such as underwater). You can also command it to speak or make other noises at a booming volume that can be heard thousands of feet away.

If the illusion is an object's or structure's image, you can take an action to make cosmetic changes to the illusion, such as color, decorations, inscribed symbols, and paintings. You can also take an action to mentally command it to move as you desire, with a fly speed of 120 feet (it maintains the same fly speed in a liquid environment such as underwater).
If the distance between you and the illusion exceeds 1 mile, the spell ends.

spell.name: Topsy Turvy
entries: You create a brief sensory distortion within a 15-foot radius sphere, making creatures within it see the world twist around them and experience unsettling sensations that disrupt their balance. Every creature within the affected area must also make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature falls {@condition prone} and has disadvantage on attack rolls, Dexterity ability checks and Dexterity saving throws until the start of its next turn.

spell.name: Torturous Deception
entries: You take control of a weakened creature's senses (the creature must be at 10 hit points or less), making them experience an environment which makes the target feel tense, upset, or agitated. You may also have the target perceive you as another creature of your choice or imagining; you can change form in the illusion as a bonus action. The target can make a Charisma saving throw whenever it ends its turn. After three consecutive successful saves, the spell ends. As a bonus action, you can cause yourself to perceive the environment as the target perceives it, as if both of you are in the same illusory location together (another bonus action shifts your senses back to normal). If the distance between you and the target exceeds 30 feet, the spell ends.

spell.name: Transient Shackles
entries: You create solid quasi-real shackles connected to the ground by chains, that attempt to ensnare the legs of another creature. One Large or smaller creature you can see within a range must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition restrained} until the end of its next turn. The {@condition restrained} creature can take an action on its turn to break free from the shackles with a Strength ability check made against your spellcasting DC. The spell ends immediately if the creature escapes from the shackles. The shackles and chains vanish when the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a slot of 4th level or higher, you can target a Huge creature. When you cast this spell with a slot of 7th level or higher, you can target a Gargantuan creature (no larger than 30 ft. by 30 ft.).

spell.name: True Reflection
entries: Until the spell ends, you cause a reflective surface (or part of it) no larger than 30 feet across to display the true form of any creature whose image is reflected. Creatures that normally have no reflection will also have the reflections of their true forms displayed.

spell.name: Untraceable Trail
entries: You and up to eight willing creatures within 5 feet of you have your trails disguised by illusion to deter trackers from following. The footprints and other traces of movement (including odors, hairs, or drops of blood) left behind by the affected creatures during the past 10 minutes become impossible to detect by nonmagical means until the spell ends.
If this spell is cast as a ritual, the duration increases to 8 hours.

spell.name: Vengeful Accusers
entries: You point your finger to accuse a creature you can see within range of a crime that you name, causing the target to remember its past commitments of the named crime, even if its memories are currently suppressed somehow. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, all of the victims directly resulting from the named crime appear within 30 feet of the target as ghostly apparitions (if there is no direct victims, then duplicates of the target appear instead). These are not the actual victims, but illusory constructs with the ability to speak any language that you speak.

Each of the constructs can be individually asked to give testimony, at which point the target can make a Charisma saving throw. On a successful save, the construct is destroyed. On a failed save, the construct audibly describes the details of an instance of the named crime that was committed by the target, including the time and date of the crime. If the target makes its third consecutive successful Charisma save, or there are no more constructs left, the spell ends.
If this spell is cast as a ritual, there is no initial saving throw

spell.name: Vertigo
entries: You cause one Large or smaller creature you can see within range to see the world twist around it and to experience unsettling sensations that disrupt its balance. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it falls {@condition prone} and has disadvantage on attack rolls, Dexterity ability checks and Dexterity saving throws until the start of its next turn.

spell.name: Vertigo Storm

m.text: a multi-colored crystal, worth at least 100 gp, which the spell consumes)

entries: You create a field of twisting images, sounds, and gravitational sensations in a 30-foot radius sphere within range. Every creature within the affected area when this spell is cast must make a Wisdom saving throw; on a failed save, the creature falls {@condition prone}. The following effects are applied until the spell ends:

items: Attacks made against and attacks made by creatures within the affected area have disadvantage.
Dexterity saving throws made by creatures within the affected area against effects that they must see to avoid have disadvantage.
Perception checks made within the affected area to perceive sights or sounds have disadvantage.
Perception checks made by creatures outside the affected area to perceive sights and sounds originating from within the affected area have disadvantage.
A creature entering or starting its turn within the affected area must make a Wisdom saving throw; on a failed save, the creature falls {@condition prone}.
For every 10 feet that a creature moves through the affected area, it must make a Wisdom saving throw; on a failed save, the creature falls {@condition prone}.

spell.name: Wall of Invisibility
entries: You create an {@condition invisible}, intangible, illusory wall in unoccupied space within range. The wall appears in any orientation you choose: horizontally, vertically, or diagonally. It can be free floating, or it can rest on a solid surface. The wall can be up to 60 feet long, 30 feet high, and 1 inch thick. When the spell ends, the wall vanishes.
You can choose one of the following effects when you cast this spell.

items: Creatures on one side of the wall (of your choice) can not see creatures on the other side of the wall, as if the creatures on the other side are {@condition invisible}.
Creatures on both sides of the wall can not see creatures on the other side of the wall, as if the creatures on the other side are {@condition invisible}.

entries: You may choose to let creatures of your choice on either side of the wall to be visible to creatures on the other side.

spell.name: Wall of Misdirection
entries: A wall of swirling multi-colored mist, flashing lights, and strange images from your imagination appears in unoccupied space within range. Creatures within the wall are inundated with false sensations and a warping of their sense of direction. The wall appears in any orientation you choose: horizontally, vertically, or diagonally. It can be free floating, or it can rest on a solid surface. The wall can be up to 40 feet long, 20 feet high, and 10 feet thick. The wall blocks line of sight, but creatures and objects can pass through it.

Whenever a creature enters or moves 5 feet through the wall's affected area, it must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature can only move in the opposite direction for their next 5 feet of movement.

spell.name: Wall of Reflection
entries: You create a mirror-like illusory wall in unoccupied space within range. The wall appears in any orientation you choose: horizontally, vertically, or diagonally. It can be free floating, or it can rest on a solid surface. The wall can be up to 60 feet long, 30 feet high, and 1 inch thick. You can choose to have the wall be reflective on one side or both sides; if the wall is only reflective on one side then it is transparent to the other side. Creatures and objects can pass through the wall.

The reflective nature of the wall may repel certain types of effects related to light (at the DM's discretion), such as blinding light or beams of light. To a viewer on the transparent side of a one-sided wall, blinding light will appear as if filling the other side of the wall with the hue of the light, extending beyond the wall on the transparent side as bright light.

spell.name: Winged Messenger
entries: You create an intangible, illusory construct resembling a Tiny flying creature or object of your imagining; the construct immediately flies towards one creature that you are familiar with when you finish casting. The construct can pass through solid obstructions but is destroyed if it attempts to pass through a dead magic zone, antimagic field, or barrier of magical force. The construct flies at a speed of 10 miles per hour, and when it arrives within 5 feet of the target, it delivers an audible message (up to the maximum safe volume for the listeners) that you recorded during the spell's casting (up to a maximum of 1 minute of recorded speech). When the message is completely delivered, or the construct is destroyed, or the duration ends, the spell ends and the construct vanishes.
If this spell is cast as a ritual, you can record up to 10 minutes of audible speech during the spell's casting.

spell.name: Zone of Discretion
entries: A zone of sound-twisting illusion is projected up to 30 feet from you, moving with you and protecting your conversation from being overheard. The words spoken by you and creatures of your choice within the zone can not be heard by other creatures, even if one of the creatures screams.

spell.name: Zone of Invisibility

m.text: powdered silver worth at least 1 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You create a fixed area in which creatures are rendered {@condition invisible}, fitting within a 20-foot cube. Any creature that is within the affected area when you cast this spell is rendered {@condition invisible} until it leaves the area. Any creature that enters the affected area is rendered {@condition invisible} until it leaves the area. Equipment and objects that are worn or carried by affected creatures are also rendered {@condition invisible}. If a creature within the affected area attacks or casts a spell, it becomes unaffected by the spell until the end of its next turn.
If you cast this spell as a ritual, you can add one or more of the following effects.

items: Only creatures that fulfill certain conditions are affected by the spell, or unaffected.
Creatures affected by the spell can be seen by creatures that fulfill certain conditions.
Creatures within the affected area can see themselves and other creatures within the affected area.

entries: If you cast this spell as a ritual, you can make the spell's duration permanent by instead using silver powder worth at least 100 gp for the material component.
